title: First look at Winter Love Island as Labour MP tweets snap of auditions
text:

The first look at Winter Love Island was revealed in unlikely fashion by a Labour MP.

ITV confirmed earlier this year that there will be two editions of the dating show in 2020 - the usual summer version and a brand new series that will kick off in January from South Africa.

TV bosses are now in the process of whittling down single hopefuls to source a dream cast for the hotly anticipated series.

During a visit to Salford's Media City, Labour MP Andrew Gwynne stumbled across a queue of auditions for the show.

(Image: Twitter)

The politician, who represents Denton and Reddish, tweeted a snap of some would-be contestants hoping to impress producers.

"Heaven or Hell? Arrive at ITV @MediaCityUK to the joys of @LoveIsland auditions!" Andrew told his followers on Twitter .

"Best of luck Andrew," one of his followers joked in the replies.

(Image: REX)

Following the huge record breaking success of this year's summer of love, Love Island bosses have been given the green light to produce a winter edition of the reality show.

It will less than six months after Amber Gill and Greg O'Shea seized the final prize, before breaking up weeks later.

As usual Caroline Flack will be overseeing all the romantic connections - and rejections - as the host.

While comedian Iain Stirling will also return to give his hilarious insights in the villa goings on.

(Image: Matt Frost/ITV/REX)

(Image: ITV)

Further details have been kept under wraps, but Iain did tease a few details during a recent appearance on Good Morning Britain.

"Do you know what, it’s gonna be an absolute blast.

"Winter Love Island is gonna come back sooner than you thought and it’s gonna be enjoyable.”

The closing date for auditions is 30 November 2019 - so there is still time if you want a bag a place.
description: The much-loved dating show is returning for two series in 2020 starting off with a brand spanking new winter version
